id: 462
text: er-BioNTech (M = PZ) and AstraZeneca (M = AZ). Pfizer-BioNTech, which we refer to as "Pfizer," also represents the Moderna vaccines. We denote the fraction of Pfizer vaccines by εPZ and the remainder εAZ= 1−εPZare AstraZeneca. Those who received the first dose will receive their second dose and M, where M denotes either PZ or AZ, as dosing interval differs between vaccine enter the V2 types. Mixed vaccination is not represented. Individuals vaccinated with one or two doses lose their immunity at a rate of ηV1 and ηV2, respectively, and enter the  SVRclass. We assume that those who lost the immunity did so unwittingly so would not get vaccinated again. M class at rate of ω2 dS dt = −S (cid:31) X=W,A,D (cid:30) βX IX total + ω1 (cid:29) + µ(N − S) (2) dS
